eu.focusnet.app.ui.activity

Class ProjectsListingActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Activity
      • android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
        • android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity
          • eu.focusnet.app.ui.activity.ToolbarEnabledActivity
            • eu.focusnet.app.ui.activity.ProjectsListingActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompatApi23.RequestPermissionsRequestCodeValidator, android.support.v4.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, android.support.v7.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, android.support.v7.app.AppCompatCallback

    public class ProjectsListingActivity
extends ToolbarEnabledActivity
    This Activity contains the listing of all projects, and is therefore the welcome screen of our application after the login and loading screens.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  ProjectsListingActivity.SyncTask
      Task responsible for synchronizing data

      Called when the user explicitly launches data sync via the dialog of the action bar.

      • doInPageUiOperations

        protected void doInPageUiOperations()
        Do any UI operation that do not imply creating and including a new Fragment in the UI. The following is performed depending on which menu item is selected: - if projects or bookmarks listing: highlight the appropriate menu item - if About, then display a dialog with the information about the app - If Logout, then reset the application

        See super#applyUiChanges().

        Overrides:
        doInPageUiOperations in class ToolbarEnabledActivity

      • prepareNewFragment

        protected void prepareNewFragment()
        Defines the Fragment to include in the container for this Activity. Either the project listing fragment or the bookmarks listing fragment.

        See super#applyUiChanges().

        Overrides:
        prepareNewFragment in class ToolbarEnabledActivity

      • onBackPressed

        public void onBackPressed()
        Listener for the back button. We have 2 menu entries in the drawer menu that load their fragment in the main content container.

        In getOnClickDrawerItemListener(), we make sure we do not reload the same page indefinitely such that the below logic can work.

        Overrides:
        onBackPressed in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
